content.paragraph: There are three key things that make Online Groups work:

bulletlist.listitem: technology — basic technology that enables email to be used as a group collaboration medium and files to be shared online
boundaries — clearly defined membership and participation protocols
participation — the more you use them, the better they work

content.heading2: How the Online Groups Technology Works
content.paragraph: Online Groups are based on an Internet eMail List Server. You may have used other List Servers or "Email Groups" such as Yahoo! Groups.
Each Online Group has an email address. The basic functioning of the Online Group is that all "posts" (emails) sent to the Online Group's email address are emailed to all members of the group.
Posts made to Online Groups also appear in the "Messages" section of the Online Group in this website. Posts can not be deleted from the Messages area.
You can send file attachments to Online Groups. The files will be added to your post as links. Members of the group can retrieve the files through these links if they choose.
content.heading2: How the Boundaries of Online Groups Work
content.paragraph: Online Groups work best when trust develops in the group. Trust develops best in Online Groups when the purpose, membership and participation protocols are clearly defined and maintained. The membership and participation protocol must be strictly maintained by the members and the service provider.
In the case of Online Groups, the service provider is OnlineGroups.Net. OnlineGroups.Net maintains the privacy of participation in Online Groups.
It is also critical that Participants in Online Groups maintain the boundaries. In particular, in a private Online Group, the privacy of the other members' posts must be respected.
content.heading2: How Participation makes Online Groups Work
content.paragraph: The technology and boundaries create the conditions where online collaboration can take place. It is only when people actually use it, that the potential can be realised. There is only any value in posting, if others reply. Participants have to get the ball rolling and contribute to its momentum.

Each post that is made demonstrates to the participants that the Online Group exists. It communicates to the others that the Online Group is a place where knowledge is shared - that if they share knowledge, then others will share back.
